author: nathan.bogale
title: Agricultural Marketplace + Atala
description: 皮肉なことに、全世界で8兆円とも言われる農業ビジネスにおいて、農家は収穫物を売り切る際の価格を決めることができません。

f6_assessments.q0: この提案は課題を効果的に解決しており、成功すれば発展途上国の農家やCardanoのエコシステムに大きな影響を与えることになります。提案者は、問題点（中間業者が市場を操作し、農家に不利益をもたらすこと）と、それを解決するためのソリューション（P2P売買システム）を見事に説明しています。欲を言えば、提案者が具体的にどこで活動を開始するのかを示してほしかったが、「サハラ以南の国々」に焦点を当てることで、いずれにしても大きなインパクトを与えることができるだろう。また、農家が団結してこの問題に取り組んでいる証拠を提示することで、提案者は対象となる人々にこのソリューションが受け入れられる可能性をさらに正当化しています。政府の直接的な支援がないことに若干の不安はあるものの、提案者の「作れば来る」という姿勢には敬意を表したいし、このアプリケーションによって農家自身にもたらされる利益が期待できることで、不安は多少解消される。このようなプログラムにAtala Prismを統合することは、安全性と透明性を提供するための優れたアイデアであり、時間が経てば他のPrism関連プロジェクトや製品との互換性も生まれます。
f6_assessments.q1: はい、提示された経験と計画を考慮すると、この提案がうまく実行される可能性は高いです。提案者は問題点を非常によく示しており、カルダノの形に忠実に、個人の手に力を取り戻す強力なソリューションを提供しています。提案者のgithubアカウントへのリンクに感謝します。興味のある投票者は、提案者の実現能力を確認するためにコードリポジトリにアクセスすることができます。最初のスキャンでは、提案者は非常に有能です。計画は非常に優れており、提案者がプロジェクトの前提条件、制約条件、リスクを十分に理解し、それらに対処するための予備的な計画を持っていることは明らかです。ロードマップとタイムラインもよくできていますし、フェーズごとの内訳（各フェーズの予算要求を含む）も、提案者が目標達成のために必要なステップを考え抜いていることを、投票者に確信させるものとなっています。5点ではなく4点としたのは、このソリューションが成功した場合に政府がこのソリューションを採用することを受け入れるかどうか、という大きな前提が示されていないからです。フェーズ1では政府が参加すると書かれていますが、それがどのように行われるのかは不明です。あなたが特定したいくつかの政府に対して、すでにリードがありますか？原則的なサポートは得られているのでしょうか？政府が受け入れず、ブローカー側についた場合の対応策は？これらが考慮されていないとは思いませんが、投票者は少しリスクを負うことになり、満点を与える前に回答を求められる可能性があります。
f6_assessments.q2: はい、提案の進捗状況や成功を監査するのに十分な情報が提供されています。提案者は、資金が提供された場合に、有権者が何を期待できるかを明確にするために素晴らしい仕事をしています。詳細な問題の説明、革新的な解決策、それを実現する方法の概要は、わかりやすく明確です。予算の内訳を見れば、どの活動や成果物にどのようなリソースが必要なのかがわかるので、有権者にとっては推測の域を出ません。欲を言えば、プロジェクトの成功がどのように評価されるのか、有権者が知るための明確なKPIがあればいいと思います。プロジェクトの成功とは、プロジェクトが完了することなのか、それともX件の農家が登録することなのか。あるいは、Y個の管轄区域が参加することなのか？このような詳細は、有権者がいつ成功したと言えるのかを知るために重要です。全体的に素晴らしい仕事だと思います。

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement and solution describe a marketplace, I would like the team to rework the problem statement and solution to show how Atala Prism is used to accelerate DID.
f6_assessments.q1: The team gave work experience of the lead team member, it would be good to see details about the other team members. Furthermore, it will be good if the proposal expanded on the go to market strategy to acquire customers for the marketplace. Lastly, I would like the proposal to expand on the backend tie in with cardano
f6_assessments.q2: The project has a high level roadmap with milestones. i would like if the team developed the roadmap further by adding KPIs (sign 15 farmers by month 3, sign up 60 farmers by month 6, etc) to the milestones, in this way you can track performance over time. I would like the team to further breakdown the budget, at the moment the budget is a high level 3 line item. As the project stands at the moment I believe it will be challenging to audit the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Great and brilliant idea by the proposer. This proposal addressess the challenge and has the potential of bringing value to the cardano ecosystem. It will really be exciting to see the execution of this project where power is given back to the farmer to be able to directly deal with the consumers
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer possess the required experience to execute the project. However the proposer failed to provide the details of team members who will help in the execution of the project when funded this i think doesn't make the proposal complete. Furthermore the budget looks a bit high and not broken down into sub components. This i think is not enough to help assessors make or pass a conclusive judgement.
f6_assessments.q2: Great job done by the proposer by providing a roadmap for project execution, he has also clearly stated the risk associated with the project but has not provided a measure to address the risk. Key deliverables are also captured in the proposal which makes it possible to track the progress and success of the  project.

f6_assessments.q0: The use of Atala Prism and DIDs to connect farmers and merchants is a good idea, and fits within the scope of this category. The general idea is clear, but more information on the technological side would greatly enhance the quality of this proposal. For example, what organism would issue the identification and how would the DIDs be managed, and by whom ? Does it involve a DAO ? Will there be a pilot program to try and gauge the farmers' willingness to participate ? Answering some of these questions would better position this project in the Accelerate Decentralized Identity category.
f6_assessments.q1: The scope of this project is big enough, but there is too little information about the team that will be executing the necessary steps. The requested funds are not small, and the expertise needed is vast. Including information about team members and how will the different components of this projects be distributed would add a lot of value to this proposal. There seems to be a lot of ideas but few technical descriptions to aspire confidence, detailing the execution steps would make this proposal more appealing. The idea is great, it just lacks some important details. If the proposal can fix these, they would have much higher chances of attracting voters.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal contains a roadmap that describes the general evolution of the project, but it is too broad. Having clear goals and metrics for evaluating progress would make it easier for the community to follow it. For example, specifying the number of farmers who would be participating or simply contacted would help a little. The proposer could also detail the steps for DID generation and what progress looks like with regard to the establishment and development of a DID framework for farmers.

f6_assessments.q0: This project can have a huge impact and is the interest and benefit of the small farmers. Farmers need to get a better price for their products, but the final product for the consumer must also remain affordable, this needs to be considered.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal concerns sub-Saharan farmers, do these farmers have access to the internet and digital devices? This also means extra administrative burdens for them, do they have the time and space for this? Good to see that these farmers are being trained to use the platform, this is necessary.
f6_assessments.q2: A good roadmap has been made, but it is completely focused on the development of the platform. The intermediary must also be very reliable and extremely well screened and possibly monitored from 'higher up' as well. KPIs to measure success are still a bit lacking. The budget is divided transparently.

f6_assessments.q0: A blockchain based digital agricultural marketplace, where parties directly buy produces from small holder farmers, cutting middlemen out is a great way to address the challenge since it can affect many people and give them better life. This proposal can also bring the use of Cardano or blockchain in general to be more community focus and become valuable as bring more the good thing to the market by making free and fair.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal said he has designed & implemented the first digital agricultural platform in Ethiopia but it's better to include evident/demonstration of this information. He seems understand the problem and was able to explain the plan step by step clearly, although still not very detailed. But the proposal shows that he's been thinking hard about how to turn the idea into reality. The strategic and context analysis is very well done. In addition, the Phases of project are planned logically.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has milestones but doesn't have key metrics/KPIs to measure the success.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a high quality, noble proposal with leveraging Atal PRISM DIDs, to help improve a struggling AG and Farmer's world. In current times, the Farmers need someone supporting them. I personally know many small farmers, and run a small farm myself. The small farmers I know, make barely enough profit to pay for the year's requirements, leaving virtually no profit. This idea will help give the farmers a voice and a chance to improve their market. I wish the best of luck educating the farmers!
f6_assessments.q1:
The relative experience is limited specifically in the proposal, related to familiarization of the agriculture industry. However, with the information and details provided, it is apparent that the proposer does have a good understanding of agriculture and farmer struggles. In addition, in viewing the proposer's GitHub, there is at least a foundational knowledge of Atala PRISM.
The plan is well thought out. And a reasonable time frame of 12 months. It is always important to be aware the amount of time involved in such an effort.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics to measure the success here are easily extrapolated. They will broadly and certainly begin with demonstrating successful farmer education and their desire to use the platform (in various ways). Then the issuance of the DIDs. Finally, the marketplace.

solution: ブロックチェーンを利用したデジタル農業市場で、中間業者を排除し、小規模農家から直接生産物を購入することができます。
experience: ネイサン・ボガレは、ソリューションアーキテクトであり、起業家でもあります。エチオピア初のデジタル農業プラットフォームを設計・導入しました。
